channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Anerley Hill SE19 opposite side of the road to, 27th November
item.description:
Anerley Hill SE19 opposite side of the road to number 8 is a plain concrete wall which is graffiti tagged. Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4196786,-0.0769545,3a,75y,29.2h,69.17t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1spUgM0XskZcPvFqrf-gVplQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D20.83474143551277%26panoid%3DpUgM0XskZcPvFqrf-gVplQ%26yaw%3D29.199077525632962!7i16384!8i8192?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTEyMy4xIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bins and repeated obstruction, 27th November
item.description:
No 20 vernham road constantly leaving their bins on vambery road. They should not be doing this. I have complained several times. Not only should they not ne doing this, they leave the bins obstructing the pavement. There are two other bins with no number on them that are continually left also obstructing the pavement.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vambery Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Pavement not fixed properly, 27th November
item.description:
The pavements on our road are made of paving slabs. These attempts at repairs with tarmac have ruined the pavement. Elsewhere on the street also repaired but with slabs same day. Doesn't make sense and looks awful. Has ruined our pavements.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vambery Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose Paving At More London Place, Tooley St., 27th November
item.description:
There are several loose paving's at More London Place as per the attached pictures. I witnessed someone trip over the one in the first pic. (near the pole). There are other loose pavings nearby that also need to be fixed. (The whole area is paved with thin pavings that are susceptible to easily becoming loose, and I think they should all be checked.)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, More London Place, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover, 27th November
item.description:
The manhole cover on Norman road( in front of BPTW architecture company,SE10 9JE) is loosed and very noisy in the night( when cars passed it). Please fix it ASAP
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Norman Road, Greenwich

item.title: Gipsy Road SE27 at Gipsy Hill junction is, 27th November
item.description:
Gipsy Road SE27 at Gipsy Hill junction is a zebra crossing with one Belisha Beacon not working tonight. (99.99% certain Lambeth side of boarder with Southwark.) NB Your own website does not seem to have Belisha Beacon option and I know from previous reports does not come under your streetlight contractor.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 248, Gipsy Road, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van been dumped no registration plates, 27th November
item.description:
Van has been dumped, hazard for any young lady or pensioners because where it is parked and blocks any views of the narrow walkway. It has been here for a while, it needs to be removed, you can't see around it at night, im worried if there is any people lurking around the vehicle. Rubbish inside vehicle, no registration plate and tyres look deflated. Needs to be removed please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: West side of Tennyson Road at junction with Glengall Road, 27th November
item.description:
A previous request for removing slippery leaves on this busy thoroughfare has not removed the hazard. A man came with a blower on 26th or 27th November but this was of no use since there are piles of mouldy wet leaves stuck to the pavement. He did not pick up a single leaf so they are still there. I just spent an hour sweeping some of it up. Not acceptable with the amount of council tax we pay. Your system should not be saying a job is complete when not a single leaf has been collected.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tennyson Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
